clinical_study.brief_title: An Study of Patients With Ph- Chromosome-negative Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia in the US
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study of Patients With Philadelphia Chromosome-negative Relapsed or Refractory Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia in the US

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective chart review study of Philadelphia chromosome-negative R/R ALL patients in the US.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure treatment patterns in patients with Ph- R/R ALL
Measure drug utilization in patients with Ph- R/R ALL
Measure healthcare resource utilization following relapse in patients with Ph- R/R ALL
Measure the receipt of allogeneic stem cell transplantation following salvage treatment
Measure the incidence of selected adverse events including cytokine release syndrome, neurologic events, any events resulting in hospitalizations, and other serious adverse events.
Measure the best response to salvage treatment (chemotherapy or blinatumomab) within 8 weeks and within 12 weeks of initiation of salvage treatment.
Measure the MRD status within 12 weeks of initiation of salvage treatment
Measure overall survival from the time of initiation of salvage treatment
Measure RFS from time remission achieved with salvage treatment

arm_group.description: It is planned to have 20 sites participating on the trial for chart review of approximately 400 patients initiating treatment for Philadelphia chromosome-negative (Ph-) Relapsed or Refractory (R/R) Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) between June 2014 and December 2016.
Initial record abstraction will occur at study site with subsequent reviews occurring at the site every 3 months thereafter until study conclusion on December 2017.

intervention.description: No intervention other than routine medical care

study_pop.textblock: Patients initiating treatment for Philadelphia chromosome-negative (Ph-) R/R ALL between June 2014 and December 2016 at participating clinical sites in the US

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical records of patients initiating treatment for Ph- R/R ALL at participating clinical centers in the US between June 2014 and December 2016 will be eligible for inclusion.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical records of patients with Ph+ ALL will be excluded
- If informed consent is required, medical records of patients who do not provide informed consent will be excluded
